org.jimmutable.core.serialization

Class JavaCodeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jimmutable.core.serialization.JavaCodeUtils

  • public class JavaCodeUtils
extends Object
    Various static utility functions that are helpful when writing unit test etc. in Java

    jim.kane

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaCodeUtils

        public JavaCodeUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • toJavaStringLiteral

        public static String toJavaStringLiteral(String src)
        Lets say you have a string that contains special characters (e.g. quotes, newlines, etc.) and you want to turn it into a Java String literal (i.e. something you can copy paste into java). toJavaStringLiteral is your answer!
        Parameters:
        src - Any valid java string
        Returns:
        A java string literal, ready to copy/paste into java source code without compilation errors

      • toJavaStringLiteral

        public static String toJavaStringLiteral(StandardObject<?> obj)
        Conventience method that takes a StandardObject, pretty prints its XML and then "serializes" the object to java code (rather useful when writing unit tests...)
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to serialize to java code
        Returns:
        Java code that will construct obj

      • prettyPrintXML

        public static String prettyPrintXML(String xml,
                                    String default_value)
        Take some XML and "pretty print" it (indent, newlines etc.)
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML to pretty print
        default_value - The value to return if an error is encountered (i.e. the XML is invalid etc.). Frequently, this is either null or xml (which, effectively means, hey, try and pretty print this -- if you can't, do nothing)
        Returns:
        The pretty printed XML, or default value if this can not be achieved
